content.question: The Metropolitan Museum of Art/Gift of George D. Pratt, 1933 In the Inka tunic shown, visual unity is achieved through

choices.label: patterns of Inka writing and numbers
a ratio in its measurements of three to one
the alternation of selected shapes and colors
an avoidance of human or animal shapes

content.answer: the alternation of selected shapes and colors

topic.text: 5.2: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in Indigenous American Art

skill.text: Skill 5.B: In analyzing a work of art beyond the image set, explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, technique, and/or content shape a work of art (or group of related works of art).
